bullets.text: ML is a subfield of AI focused on systems learning from data without explicit programming.
Core idea: systems identify patterns and make decisions with minimal human intervention.
Crucial in modern tech: image recognition, NLP, predictive analytics, autonomous vehicles.
Growth driven by large datasets, improved computational power, and advanced algorithms.
Broadly classified into Supervised, Unsupervised, and Reinforcement Learning.
Supervised Learning: Model trained on labeled data to predict known outputs (e.g., Regression, Classification).
Unsupervised Learning: Model trained on unlabeled data to find hidden patterns (e.g., Clustering, Dimensionality Reduction).
Reinforcement Learning: Agent learns by interacting with an environment to maximize cumulative rewards.
Model Training: Feeding data to a model to learn patterns and adjust parameters to minimize loss.
Features and Labels: Features are input variables, labels are target outputs in supervised learning.
Training and Testing Sets: Data split for training the model and evaluating its performance on unseen data.
Overfitting: Model learns training data too well, performs poorly on new data; addressed by regularization.
Underfitting: Model is too simple to capture patterns, performs poorly on all data; addressed by more complex models.
Linear Regression: Supervised algorithm for regression tasks, models linear relationships.
Logistic Regression: Supervised algorithm for classification tasks, models class probabilities.
Decision Trees: Non-linear model for regression/classification, splits data based on features.
Random Forest: Ensemble method combining multiple decision trees for improved performance.
Support Vector Machines (SVM): Powerful classification algorithm finding optimal hyperplane.
Neural Networks: Algorithms inspired by the human brain, learning complex patterns in data.
Healthcare: Disease diagnosis, drug discovery, personalized treatment recommendations.
Finance: Fraud detection, credit scoring, algorithmic trading.
Marketing: Customer segmentation, recommendation systems, targeted advertising.
Autonomous Vehicles: Self-driving cars rely on ML for real-time decision-making and navigation.
Natural Language Processing (NLP): Language translation, sentiment analysis, chatbots.
ML is a powerful tool for learning from data, making predictions, and automating decisions.
Understanding types, concepts, and algorithms is key to applying ML in real-world scenarios.
The field continues to evolve, with deep learning and AI offering limitless possibilities.
